idea-plugin.name: Structured Templates
idea-plugin.description: A plugin for defining reusable hierarchical structure templates composed of folders and files, powered by IntelliJ File Templates.
idea-plugin.change-notes:
• Added icons to the template tree and to the file‑template selection UI for clearer visual navigation.
  • File names now automatically include the correct extension derived from the selected File Template—no need to manually type .ext anymore.
  • Expanded the File Template selection list to include built‑in templates such as HTML and others previously unavailable.
  • Introduced a new variable: ${FILE_NAME_KEBAB}. It joins the existing ${FILE_NAME_PASCAL} and ${FILE_NAME_CAMEL} naming helpers.
  • Templates containing live‑template variables now open in the editor with interactive placeholders, allowing users to fill values and navigate between them using Tab.
  • Added shortcuts for “Create New Template”, “Add Folder”, and “Add File” directly in the context menu.
  • Creating a new file or folder while a file is selected now automatically places it under the nearest parent folder/template for more intuitive structure editing.
  • Added Delete key support to quickly remove nodes directly from the keyboard.
